org.gbif.dwc

Class ArchiveFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.dwc.ArchiveFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Record>

    public class ArchiveFile
extends Object
implements Iterable<Record>
    This class encapsulates information about a file contained within a Darwin Core Archive. It represents the fileType object described in the Darwin Core Archive XSD.
    See Also:
    Darwin Core Archive XSD

        public List<ArchiveField> getFieldsSorted()
        Provides the List of ArchiveFields, ordered by the column they are mapped to, with unmapped (default/fixed value) columns first.
        Returns:
        Ordered data structure of archive fields.

      • getRawArchiveFields

        public List<ArchiveField> getRawArchiveFields()
        Return a copy of the raw ArchiveField. This function is mostly used for validation purpose. May include duplicates.
        Returns:

      • getHeader

        public List<List<Term>> getHeader()
        Generates a list of Terms mapped to each column in the underlying file. A list may be empty when no Term is mapped at a specific position, or may contain more than one Term where the same column is mapped more than once. The length of the list is the maximum index used in the ArchiveFields + 1.
        Returns:
        Data structure representing the header of the file.

      • getDefaultValues

        public Optional<Map<Term,String>> getDefaultValues()
        Get default values mapped to their Term (if any).
        Returns:
        default values or Optional.empty() if none

        public String getLocation()
        Get the first file location. TODO: check if we got more than 1 file and implement some unix concat into a single file first before sorting that
        Returns:
        first location or null if none

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • iterator

        public ClosableIterator<Record> iterator(boolean replaceNulls,
                                         boolean replaceEntities)
        Get a ClosableIterator over the records in this file, optionally replacing nulls and entities.
        Parameters:
        replaceNulls - if true replaces common, literal NULL values with real nulls, e.g. "\N" or "NULL"
        replaceEntities - if true HTML & XML entities in record values will be replaced with the interpreted value.
